parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS system can cause extended stopping distances, loss of control, and accidents, which can lead to injuries or fatalities.
The failure of the brake master cylinder can cause the brake pedal to stick to the floor, making it difficult or impossible to stop the vehicle, which can lead to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: Brake pedal feels soft or spongy
brake pedal sticks to the floor
brake pedal does not return to its normal position

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake hydraulic system can cause the brake pedal to stick to the floor, making it difficult or impossible to stop the vehicle, which can lead to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: Brake pedal feels soft or spongy
brake pedal sticks to the floor
brake pedal does not return to its normal position

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the wheel speed sensor can cause the ABS system to malfunction, leading to extended stopping distances, loss of control, and accidents, which can lead to injuries or fatalities.
The intermittent failure of the windshield wipers can cause reduced visibility while driving, especially in rainy or snowy conditions, which can lead to accidents.
symptoms: Windshield wipers stop working or work intermittently
wipers stick or park in the center of the windshield
wipers can be restarted by wiggling or moving the wiper motor
wipers work only for a short time before stopping again.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Engine failure and performance issues can cause the vehicle to stall, lose power, or become difficult to control, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
Sudden acceleration can cause the vehicle to become uncontrollable, leading to accidents or loss of control.
symptoms: Vehicle suddenly accelerates for no reason
vehicle fails to stop when brakes are applied
vehicle throws a tie rod into the motor and damages it.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Exhaust system failure can cause noise, vibrations, and potentially lead to engine damage or failure.
Cooling system failure can cause engine overheating, damage, or failure, leading to loss of control or accidents.
EGR valve failure can cause complete brake loss and loss of control, leading to accidents or loss of control.
symptoms: engine surges forward intermittently due to EGR failure.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Motor mount failure can cause engine shifting, oil leaks, and potentially lead to engine damage or failure.
symptoms: shifting engine oil filter into mounting bolt
puncturing filter and spewing oil on hot engine.
